page.title: 20Farming
page.content: Joseph Tatton and Tom Bradley In 1985 the main occupation in Hollinsclough is farming, mainly dairy and sheep.On 8/7/85 we visited Mr.Ronnie Gilman's farm.We saw an enourmous corn bin which sends corn along pipes and it goes into the cow troughs so they can eat it while they get milked.The cubicle shed has rows of cubicles and the calves stay in there all winter.The silage pit has a hill of silage(cut grass)with a big plastic sheet over it,and there are tyres on top to keep air out. When the cows come up the road and they get stones stuck in their feet, that is why they go through the foot dip.It takes 4minutes to milk a cow and it takes 2hours to milk all of them.
